alert.note: Alert for Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 11:52AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Hot Springs and northwestern Washakie Counties through 1230 PM MDT... At 1149 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm 11 miles northeast of Legend Rock State Petroglyph Site, or 23 miles northwest of Thermopolis, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Pea to Half inch hail. Small hail may briefly cover the ground under the core of the storm. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail may accumulate on roadways for a short time. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Hot Springs and northwestern Washakie Counties, including the following locations... Badlands Overlook. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rain may briefly occur with this storm.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin
